data.message: Facebook....why do you allow these advertisers...or whatever they are to place these blurbs on the right side panel saying things like a star has died...who hasn't; a couple is married that isn't, or some other lame thing that has nothing to do with the picture.

replies.message: Hi Mindy. We strive to only show ads that are relevant and interesting to you. If you don't want to see a specific ad, you can click the x on the top right corner of the ad and choose hide. -Joe
Thanks...I hide posts...didn't know I could hide ads.  I just don't understand why you all allow the outright lies.  Is truth in advertising not relevent anymore, or just not enough manpower??

How about how often you have to delete a post before it is permanently deleted? I delete them, refresh page, they're back. Delete again, refresh page, they're back AGAIN! Delete them, shut off computer or go another page, come back to Facebook later, there they are AGAIN! Come on Facebook, FIX THIS!
Hide the Ad is your advice, Joe from FB?!?  How about, Facebook cleans up its' act and not allow misinformation.
